00007 // A (basic) class for accessing data stored on Amazon's Simple Storage Service (http://aws.amazon.com/s3/) using the REST API
00008 
00009 #import <Foundation/Foundation.h>
00010 #import "ASIHTTPRequest.h"
00011 
00012 // See http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTAccessPolicy.html for what these mean
00013 extern NSString *const ASIS3AccessPolicyPrivate; // This is the default in S3 when no access policy header is provided
00014 extern NSString *const ASIS3AccessPolicyPublicRead;
00015 extern NSString *const ASIS3AccessPolicyPublicReadWrote;
00016 extern NSString *const ASIS3AccessPolicyAuthenticatedRead;
00017 
00018 typedef enum _ASIS3ErrorType {
00019     ASIS3ResponseParsingFailedType = 1,
00020     ASIS3ResponseErrorType = 2
00021         
00022 } ASIS3ErrorType;
00023 
00024 // Prevent warning about missing NSXMLParserDelegate on Leopard and iPhone
00025 #if !TARGET_OS_IPHONE && MAC_OS_X_VERSION_10_5 < MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MAX_ALLOWED
00026 @interface ASIS3Request : ASIHTTPRequest <NSXMLParserDelegate> {
00027 #else
00028 @interface ASIS3Request : ASIHTTPRequest {
00029 
00030 #endif
00031         // Your S3 access key. Set it on the request, or set it globally using [ASIS3Request setSharedAccessKey:]
00032         NSString *accessKey;
00033         
00034         // Your S3 secret access key. Set it on the request, or set it globally using [ASIS3Request setSharedSecretAccessKey:]
00035         NSString *secretAccessKey;
00036         
00037         // Name of the bucket to talk to
00038         NSString *bucket;
00039         
00040         // Path to the resource you want to access on S3. Leave empty for the bucket root
00041         NSString *path;
00042         
00043         // The string that will be used in the HTTP date header. Generally you'll want to ignore this and let the class add the current date for you, but the accessor is used by the tests
00044         NSString *dateString;
00045         
00046         // The mime type of the content for PUT requests
00047         // Set this if having the correct mime type returned to you when you GET the data is important (eg it will be served by a web-server)
00048         // Will be set to 'application/octet-stream' otherwise in iPhone apps, or autodetected on Mac OS X
00049         NSString *mimeType;
00050         
00051         // The access policy to use when PUTting a file (see the string constants at the top of this header)
00052         NSString *accessPolicy;
00053         
00054         // The bucket + path of the object to be copied (used with COPYRequestFromBucket:path:toBucket:path:)
00055         NSString *sourceBucket;
00056         NSString *sourcePath;
00057         
00058         // Internally used while parsing errors
00059         NSString *currentErrorString;
00060         
00061 }
00062 
00063 #pragma mark Constructors
00064 
00065 // Create a request, building an appropriate url
00066 + (id)requestWithBucket:(NSString *)bucket path:(NSString *)path;
00067 
00068 // Create a PUT request using the file at filePath as the body
00069 + (id)PUTRequestForFile:(NSString *)filePath withBucket:(NSString *)bucket path:(NSString *)path;
00070 
00071 // Create a DELETE request for the object at path
00072 + (id)DELETERequestWithBucket:(NSString *)bucket path:(NSString *)path;
00073 
00074 // Create a PUT request to copy an object from one location to another
00075 // Clang will complain because it thinks this method should return an object with +1 retain :(
00076 + (id)COPYRequestFromBucket:(NSString *)sourceBucket path:(NSString *)sourcePath toBucket:(NSString *)bucket path:(NSString *)path;
00077 
00078 // Creates a HEAD request for the object at path
00079 + (id)HEADRequestWithBucket:(NSString *)bucket path:(NSString *)path;
00080 
00081 
00082 // Uses the supplied date to create a Date header string
00083 - (void)setDate:(NSDate *)date;
00084 
00085 #pragma mark Shared access keys
00086 
00087 // Get and set the global access key, this will be used for all requests the access key hasn't been set for
00088 + (NSString *)sharedAccessKey;
00089 + (void)setSharedAccessKey:(NSString *)newAccessKey;
00090 + (NSString *)sharedSecretAccessKey;
00091 + (void)setSharedSecretAccessKey:(NSString *)newAccessKey;
00092 
00093 
00094 @property (retain) NSString *bucket;
00095 @property (retain) NSString *path;
00096 @property (retain) NSString *dateString;
00097 @property (retain) NSString *mimeType;
00098 @property (retain) NSString *accessKey;
00099 @property (retain) NSString *secretAccessKey;
00100 @property (retain) NSString *accessPolicy;
00101 @property (retain) NSString *sourceBucket;
00102 @property (retain) NSString *sourcePath;
00103 @end
